alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Central Ventura County Valleys; Eastern San Fernando Valley; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Interstate 5 Corridor; Malibu Coast; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Santa Clarita Valley; Santa Susana Mountains; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast; Western San Fernando Valley; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 08 at 3:10PM PST until December 10 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH TONIGHT OVER MOST MOUNTAINS OF SANTA BARBARA COUNTY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON OVER MOST OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... .Moderate to strong north to northeast winds combined with low relative humidities will elevate the risk for extreme fire behavior if a new fire starts. The winds and risk will be focused over Santa Barbara County through tonight Friday, then shift to Los Angeles and Ventura Counties on Saturday and Sunday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM SATURDAY TO 3 PM PST SUNDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY OVER MOST OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 8 AM Saturday to 3 PM PST Sunday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WINDS...Northeast winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts to 60 mph. Isolated gusts to 70 mph. Strongest in the San Gabriel Mountains, Highway 14 Corridor, the Santa Monica Mountains, and the Santa Susana Mountains. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimums 6 to 15 percent common, driest Sunday. Very poor overnight recoveries of 12 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...If fire ignition occurs, conditions may be favorable for extreme fire behavior which would threaten life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information.
